body:
hi @keveman

sorry dont have my laptop w me to try. but are u suggesting to put the .h file under the srcs field? i can give that a try, i was under impression that srcs were cc only and h files go under hdrs. thx.

> On Apr 28, 2016, at 3:55 PM, Manjunath Kudlur notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> In tensorflow/contrib/rnn/BUILD:
> 
> > -    hdrs = [
> > -        "kernels/lstm_ops.h"
> > -    ],
> > -    gpu_srcs = [
> > -        "kernels/lstm_ops_gpu.cu.cc"
> > -    ],
> > -    deps = [
> > -        "//tensorflow/core:framework_headers_lib",
> > -        "//third_party/eigen3",
> > -    ],
> >   +)
> >   +
> >   +tf_custom_op_library(
> > -    name = "python/ops/_lstm_ops.so",
> > -    srcs = [
> > -        "ops/lstm_ops.cc",
> >   I don't understand why you can't put ops/lstm_ops.cc, kernels/lstm_ops.cc and kernels/lstm_ops.h in the srcs here. Note that hdrs is needed only if you want your cc_library to export those headers to dependent libraries. Here, that is not the case.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body_html:
hi @keveman

sorry dont have my laptop w me to try. but are u suggesting to put the .h file under the srcs field? i can give that a try, i was under impression that srcs were cc only and h files go under hdrs. thx.

On Apr 28, 2016, at 3:55 PM, Manjunath Kudlur notifications@github.com wrote:

  • name = "python/ops/_lstm_ops.so",
  • srcs = [
  •    "ops/lstm_ops.cc",
    I don't understand why you can't put ops/lstm_ops.cc, kernels/lstm_ops.cc and kernels/lstm_ops.h in the srcs here. Note that hdrs is needed only if you want your cc_library to export those headers to dependent libraries. Here, that is not the case.

—

   "ops/lstm_ops.cc",

I don't understand why you can't put ops/lstm_ops.cc, kernels/lstm_ops.cc and kernels/lstm_ops.h in the srcs here. Note that hdrs is needed only if you want your cc_library to export those headers to dependent libraries. Here, that is not the case.
